content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose to play the strategy of Tit-for-Tat in this game. This means that I will start by choosing R in the first round. If my opponent chooses R in return, we both get 45$ in the first round and I will continue with the same choice (R) to maintain a cooperative relationship. However, if my opponent chooses B in the first round, I will switch to B for the next round to punish their non-cooperative behavior but also give them an opportunity to cooperate again.

From then on, I will continue with the Tit-for-Tat strategy: if my opponent switches to R after a B, I will switch back to R; if my opponent continues with B, I will continue with B as well. This way, I can maximize my earnings and also encourage cooperation from my anonymous player, since they will see that I am reciprocating their actions.

Given this strategy, the choice I would make in the first round is R (R\_{}).
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In the second round, using the Tit-for-Tat strategy I chose in my previous response, since my opponent and I both picked R in the first round, I will continue with the same choice (R) to maintain a cooperative relationship.

Therefore, my choice for the next round is also R (R\_{}).
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 42$. Please play the next round.

In this case, my opponent chose B while I chose R, resulting in both of us getting a payoff of 0$ in the first round according to the rules of the game. Since my opponent has demonstrated non-cooperative behavior by choosing B when I cooperated with R, it is appropriate for me to respond with a punishing action.

Using the Tit-for-Tat strategy, I will switch my choice to B in the next round. This way, I can give my opponent another opportunity to cooperate and also teach them that their non-cooperative behavior has consequences.

Therefore, my choice for the next round is B (B\_{}).

Using the Tit-for-Tat strategy, I will switch my choice to R in the next round, as a sign of goodwill and an attempt to reestablish a cooperative relationship with my opponent.

Therefore, my choice for the next round is R (R\_{}).
